context: The first department stores Lane Crawford was opened in <a0_0><b4_0>1850<b4_0/><a0_0/> by <a1_0><b5_0>Scots Thomas Ash Lane and Ninian Crawford<b5_0/><a1_0/> on Des Voeux Road, Hong Kong Island. At the beginning, the store mainly catered <a2_0><b6_0>visiting ships' crews as well as British Navy staff and their families<b6_0/><a2_0/>. In 1900, the first ethnic-Chinese owned Sincere Department Store was opened by <a3_0><b7_0><b8_0>Ma Ying Piu<b8_0/><b7_0/><a3_0/>, who returned from Australia and inspired by David Jones. In 1907, another former Hong Kong expatriate in Australia, the Kwok's family, returned to Hong Kong and founded Wing On.
